features.name: Support
features.description: A price level where a stock tends to find buying interest, preventing it from falling further. It's considered a 'floor' that the price struggles to break below.

features.name: Resistance
features.description: A price level where a stock encounters selling interest, preventing it from rising further. It's considered a 'ceiling' that the price struggles to break above.

features.name: Simple Moving Average (SMA)
features.description: The average price of a stock over a specific time period, used to smooth out price data and identify trends.

features.name: Exponential Moving Average (EMA)
features.description: A type of moving average that gives more weight to recent prices.

features.name: MACD (Moving Average Convergence Divergence)
features.description: A technical indicator that helps investors identify price trends, measure trend momentum, and identify entry points for buying or selling.

features.name: Bollinger Bands
features.description: A technical analysis tool that helps investors and traders understand market volatility.

features.name: Relative Strength Index (RSI)
features.description: RSI measures the speed and magnitude of a security's recent price changes to detect overbought or oversold conditions. It can signal when to buy and sell, typically considering RSI > 70 as overbought and RSI < 30 as oversold.

features.name: Stochastic Oscillator
features.description: A momentum indicator comparing the closing price of a security to its price range over a period, used to generate overbought and oversold signals.

features.name: Price Rate of Change (ROC) Indicator
features.description: A momentum-based technical indicator that measures the percentage change in price between the current price and the price a certain number of periods ago.
